did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Black Workers in the Era of the Great Migration on Microfilm, 1916-1925
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: "Records relate to agricultural labor, industrial work, unionism, housing, race relations, returning veterans and their search for employment and the process of migration from the South to the North." (from Introduction by James R. Gross, editor). Reels 10-11 contain the records of the U.S. Railroad Administration's Women's Service Section. Reels 16-19 of this collection include records from the U.S. Women's Bureau concerning black women.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: "Records relate to agricultural labor, industrial work, unionism, housing, race relations, returning veterans and their search for employment and the process of migration from the South to the North." (from Introduction by James R. Gross, editor). Reels 10-11 contain the records of the U.S. Railroad Administration's Women's Service Section. Reels 16-19 of this collection include records from the U.S. Women's Bureau concerning black women.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Black Workers in the Era of the Great Migration on Microfilm #5750 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
